Smart contracts face a limitation in that they cannot directly access external data sources outside their blockchain environment. This gap is addressed by oracles, which serve to connect smart contracts with external data sources.

articles.description:
RTâ€‚Sardius
As a developer, why should you care about oracles when writing smart contracts?
Smart contracts face a critical limitation - they can't interact with data outside the blockchain they run on
Oracles aim to solve this problem, enabling dApps fusing on and offchain data
